history.content: I believe that three unit courses are OK (this is a CoE rule), however, you would need a petition approved for a graduate course to fulfill a graduation requirement, as seen here https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/eecs/degree-reqs-upperdiv

children.subject: I would suggest getting in contact with your ESS Advisor. They will likely need to meet with you before you're able to enroll in Spring

What happens if we don't meet this requirement? I was only able to get into one technical CS upperdiv this semester as I wasn't declared when I was choosing classes. I got dropped from the waitlist of two other upperdivs and I don't think it will be possible for me to enroll in another as everything is full. Is there something I can do at this point?

history.content:
I am currently enrolled in 2 CS 4 unit technicals, and a 3 unit CS graduate course. (I have this course approved for counting towards graduation)

Due to other priorities during the semester, I was wondering if I could drop one of the 4 unit courses, which would leave me at doing 2 CS courses that contribute towards graduation. These CS courses would total to 7 units. From the EECS degree requirements website, it states that "At least two of your courses must be letter-graded technical courses." I just want to make sure that a 3-unit course is still fine for this requirement before dropping one of my other techs. (I have enough humanities courses that I am above the 12 unit limit even w/ dropping on class)
history.subject: EECS does the 2 technicals a semester requirement apply for 3 unit classes

history.subject: Does the requirement of needing to be enrolled in 2 technicals a semester apply for 3 unit classes
